DataElement.preferredName: Gene Physical Location Gene Feature Type GeneFeatureType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The physical location of a gene expressed as chromosome and start and end base positions._The structural elements that comprise a gene or transcription unit. Gene structures include the transcription initiation site, the protein coding sequences, intervening sequences, and the transcription termination or polyadenylation sites as well as the regulatory elements (enhancers, silencers, and the promoter) that lie outside the boundaries of the transcribed unit.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities._The type of gene feature located on the genome.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The physical location of a gene expressed as chromosome and start and end base positions.

Concepts.definition: The physical location of a gene expressed as chromosome and start and end base positions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The structural elements that comprise a gene or transcription unit. Gene structures include the transcription initiation site, the protein coding sequences, intervening sequences, and the transcription termination or polyadenylation sites as well as the regulatory elements (enhancers, silencers, and the promoter) that lie outside the boundaries of the transcribed unit.:Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

Concepts.definition: The structural elements that comprise a gene or transcription unit. Gene structures include the transcription initiation site, the protein coding sequences, intervening sequences, and the transcription termination or polyadenylation sites as well as the regulatory elements (enhancers, silencers, and the promoter) that lie outside the boundaries of the transcribed unit.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 5/8/12 Released as part of caBIO v4.3 model cleanup task.  jc

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The type of gene feature located on the genome.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The sequences on a gene or messenger RNA that are translated into protein.

Concepts.definition: The sequences on a gene or messenger RNA that are translated into protein.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

Concepts.definition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Nonfunctional DNA sequences that are very similar to the sequences of known genes.  Many seem to have arisen as functional gene duplications that subsequently underwent mutation and loss of function.  Others are structurally similar to mRNA and seem to have arisen by a reverse transcription event followed by integration into the genome.  Some pseudogenes are transcribed and may play a role in regulation of its homologous gene.

Concepts.definition: Nonfunctional DNA sequences that are very similar to the sequences of known genes.  Many seem to have arisen as functional gene duplications that subsequently underwent mutation and loss of function.  Others are structurally similar to mRNA and seem to have arisen by a reverse transcription event followed by integration into the genome.  Some pseudogenes are transcribed and may play a role in regulation of its homologous gene.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A class of RNA molecule containing protein-coding information in its nucleotide sequence that can be translated into the amino acid sequence of a protein.

Concepts.definition: A class of RNA molecule containing protein-coding information in its nucleotide sequence that can be translated into the amino acid sequence of a protein.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A region of a messenger RNA that is not translated into protein.

Concepts.definition: A region of a messenger RNA that is not translated into protein.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual entities required by NCI operations and systems. Includes administrative, financial, organizational and quasi-scientific concepts required for NCI operations and systems.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.
